result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Lewis Wisdom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael Lewis Wisdom is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael Lewis Wisdom was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Michael Lewis Wisdom was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property >$10,000-$100,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Michael Lewis Wisdom was found guilty of Possess w/ Intent-Psilocin (<=100 g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(g)1.
  • Michael Lewis Wisdom was found guilty of Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Partial sentencing hearing 9-16-2022

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael Lewis Wisdom in court.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for Michael Lewis Wisdom.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. PSI and submissions in support of defendant reviewed by court. Attorney Frank heard on issues in PSI. State heard and recommends as to Count 1 WSPS 5 years (2&3), Count 2 WSPS 5 years (2&3), concurrent to Count 1. As to Count 5, WSPS 2 years (1&1), Count 6 WSPS 2 years (1&1), with Counts 5 & 6 concurrent to each other and consecutive to Counts 1 & 2. State also recommends one set court costs, DNA, restitution, counseling, drug testing, full time employment or seek at 3 applications per week and copy agent, notify agent of interviews and outcomes. Attorney Frank heard and requests imposed and stayed sentences. Mr. Wisdom heard. Court heard and orders WSPS 7 years (3&4) on Counts 1 & 2, concurrent; WSPS 2 years (1&1) on Counts 5 & 6, concurrent to each other and consecutive to Counts 1 and 2. Those sentences imposed and stayed with 5 years probation on Counts 1 and 2 and 3 years probation on Counts 5 and 6. Conditions of probation and supervision: no alcohol, no controlled substances except prescribed, random observed testing for alcohol and controlled substances, restitution for safe damage (if requested), DNA, maintain full time work or seek with 3 applications per week documenting applications and interviews with agent, costs on Counts 2 & 5, costs on Counts 1 & 6 waived, counseling, complete Thinking for Change and any other similar behavioral therapy as requested. If revoked, 5 days credit. After court, court noted defendant is eligible for programming.

Letter in Support
Defendant's Letters of Support
from James Lewis Re: Defendant
Sentencing hearing on September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Lewis Wisdom in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for Michael Lewis Wisdom. Attorney Frank heard on status of case and requests a plea hearing. Defendant is currently in a treatment facility. Court heard on entering plea today. Attorney Frank discussed with defendant and will proceed with plea today. Defendant will plead to Cts 1, 2, 5 and 6. State will move to dismiss but read in Ct 3 and dismiss Ct 4. State will recommend 5 years WSPS for Cts 1 and 2 to be concurrent to each other, 2 years WSPS of Cts 5 and 6 to be concurrent to each other but consecutive to Cts 1 and 2. Conditions of extended supervision would be to pay courts, DNA, counseling, work full time, pay restitution, and submit to random UAs. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads no contest to Cts 1, 2, 5 and 6. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty of Cts 1, 2, 5 and 6. Ct 3 is dismissed as read-in and Ct 4 is dismissed per agreement. Court reviews rights lost due to felony conviction. Attorney Frank requests PSI. Court orders PSI. Sentencing date set.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on September 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on February 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Lewis Wisdom appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, penalties, and right to counsel. Defendant is currently not employed and referred to SPD. State heard on bond and requests $1000.00 cash bond. Defendant heard on bond. Court orders a $1000 cash bond. Status as to counsel set.
